flow.descriptionCdata:
1b56cd1d-aa5d-475c-b191-864e9f7ba574.2b1337e9-2c20-409a-9daf-e8f66d5bc09f.description=Edits an XML document. Inputs\: xml - The XML (in the form of a String). filePath - Absolute or remote path of the XML file. action - The edit action to take place. Valid values\: delete, insert, append, subnode, move, rename, update. xpath1 - The XPath Query that is wanted to be run. The changes take place at the resulting elements. xpath2 - The XPath Query that is wanted to be run. For the move action the results of xpath1 are moved to the results of xpath2. value - The new value. Examples\: newNodeValue , newNodeValue, new value. type - Defines on what should the changes take effect \: the element, the value of the element or the attributes of the element. Valid values\: elem, text, attr name - The name of the attribute in case the selected type is 'attr' . parsingFeatures - The list of XML parsing features separated by new line (CRLF). The feature name - value must be separated by empty space. Setting specific features this field could be used to avoid XML security issues like "XML Entity Expansion injection" and "XML External Entity injection". To avoid aforementioned security issues we strongly recommend to set this input to the following values\: http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false When the "http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl" feature is set to "true" the parser will throw a FATAL ERROR if the incoming document contains a DOCTYPE declaration. When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external general entities. When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external parameter entities or the external DTD subset. If any of the validations fails, the operation will fail with an error message describing the problem. Default value\: http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false Results\: returnResult - This is the primary output. The edited XML. returnCode - 0 for success; -1 for failure. exception - The exception message in case one occured. Responses\: success - The operation completed as stated in the description. failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully. Notes\: 1. For the delete action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). Delete action modifies the XML only for type 'elem' or attr'. 2. For the insert action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, value, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). For type 'elem' insert adds the node before the resulting nodes of the XPath. For type 'text' insert adds the text before the text value of resulting nodes of the XPath. 3. For the append action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, value, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). For type 'elem' append adds the node after the resulting nodes of the XPath. For type 'text' append adds the text after the text value of resulting nodes of the XPath. 4. For insert and append attributes the order is the default alphabetical. 5. For the subnode action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1 and value. 6. For the move action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1 and xpath2. Move action modifies the XML only for type 'elem'. 7. For the rename action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, value, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). Rename action modifies the XML only for type 'elem' or attr'. 8. For the update action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, value, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). 9. The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) organization provides the XPath specification (http\://www.w3.org). 10. XML using default namespace is also supported by this operation. 11. An element from the default namespace can be retrieved using a location path. Examples\: 1. The following is a valid xpath example for working with a XML that uses default namespace. This example searches all "td" elements from the default namespace\: xml\:
Apples Bananas
xpath1\: //*[namespace-uri()\="http\://www.w3.org/TR/html4/" and name()\="td"] 1b56cd1d-aa5d-475c-b191-864e9f7ba574.45f35cd0-7255-4c3b-a40f-60d505192799.description=
Retrieves the value from a given XML Element. Child nodes are not considered as values.
 
Inputs\:
    xml - The xml (in the form of a String).
    parsingFeatures - The list of XML parsing features separated by new line (CRLF). The feature name - value must be separated by empty space. Setting specific features this field could be used to avoid XML security issues like "XML Entity Expansion injection" and "XML External Entity injection". To avoid aforementioned security issues we strongly recommend to set this input to the following values\: 
http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true 
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false 
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false 
When the "http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl" feature is set to "true" the parser will throw a FATAL ERROR if the incoming document contains a DOCTYPE declaration.  
When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external general entities. 
When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external parameter entities or the external DTD subset. 
If any of the validations fails, the operation will fail with an error message describing the problem. 
Default value\:
http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false

Responses\:
success 	- The value retrieved successfully.
failure 	- The operation failed.
 
Returns\:
returnResult	- The value of the given XML element.
 
Notes\:
1. The following is a valid input for this operation-
Everyday Italian
 
while the following is not a valid input and will not return any result-

    Everyday Italian
    Giada De Laurentiis
    2005
    30.00
1b56cd1d-aa5d-475c-b191-864e9f7ba574.517599f6-7f9a-4fd9-9a16-fbd3450b5c8f.description=Edits an XML document. Inputs\: xml - The XML (in the form of a String). filePath - Absolute or remote path of the XML file. action - The edit action to take place. Valid values\: delete, insert, append, subnode, move, rename, update. xpath1 - The XPath Query that is wanted to be run. The changes take place at the resulting elements. xpath2 - The XPath Query that is wanted to be run. For the move action the results of xpath1 are moved to the results of xpath2. value - The new value. Examples\: newNodeValue , newNodeValue, new value. type - Defines on what should the changes take effect \: the element, the value of the element or the attributes of the element. Valid values\: elem, text, attr name - The name of the attribute in case the selected type is 'attr' . parsingFeatures - The list of XML parsing features separated by new line (CRLF). The feature name - value must be separated by empty space. Setting specific features this field could be used to avoid XML security issues like "XML Entity Expansion injection" and "XML External Entity injection". To avoid aforementioned security issues we strongly recommend to set this input to the following values\: http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false When the "http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl" feature is set to "true" the parser will throw a FATAL ERROR if the incoming document contains a DOCTYPE declaration. When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external general entities. When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external parameter entities or the external DTD subset. If any of the validations fails, the operation will fail with an error message describing the problem. Default value\: http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false Results\: returnResult - This is the primary output. The edited XML. returnCode - 0 for success; -1 for failure. exception - The exception message in case one occured. Responses\: success - The operation completed as stated in the description. failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully. Notes\: 1. For the delete action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). Delete action modifies the XML only for type 'elem' or attr'. 2. For the insert action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, value, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). For type 'elem' insert adds the node before the resulting nodes of the XPath. For type 'text' insert adds the text before the text value of resulting nodes of the XPath. 3. For the append action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, value, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). For type 'elem' append adds the node after the resulting nodes of the XPath. For type 'text' append adds the text after the text value of resulting nodes of the XPath. 4. For insert and append attributes the order is the default alphabetical. 5. For the subnode action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1 and value. 6. For the move action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1 and xpath2. Move action modifies the XML only for type 'elem'. 7. For the rename action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, value, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). Rename action modifies the XML only for type 'elem' or attr'. 8. For the update action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, value, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). 9. The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) organization provides the XPath specification (http\://www.w3.org). 10. XML using default namespace is also supported by this operation. 11. An element from the default namespace can be retrieved using a location path. Examples\: 1. The following is a valid xpath example for working with a XML that uses default namespace. This example searches all "td" elements from the default namespace\: xml\:
Apples Bananas
xpath1\: //*[namespace-uri()\="http\://www.w3.org/TR/html4/" and name()\="td"] 1b56cd1d-aa5d-475c-b191-864e9f7ba574.7fd19437-811c-4e65-997d-444304103eed.description=Edits an XML document. Inputs\: xml - The XML (in the form of a String). filePath - Absolute or remote path of the XML file. action - The edit action to take place. Valid values\: delete, insert, append, subnode, move, rename, update. xpath1 - The XPath Query that is wanted to be run. The changes take place at the resulting elements. xpath2 - The XPath Query that is wanted to be run. For the move action the results of xpath1 are moved to the results of xpath2. value - The new value. Examples\: newNodeValue , newNodeValue, new value. type - Defines on what should the changes take effect \: the element, the value of the element or the attributes of the element. Valid values\: elem, text, attr name - The name of the attribute in case the selected type is 'attr' . parsingFeatures - The list of XML parsing features separated by new line (CRLF). The feature name - value must be separated by empty space. Setting specific features this field could be used to avoid XML security issues like "XML Entity Expansion injection" and "XML External Entity injection". To avoid aforementioned security issues we strongly recommend to set this input to the following values\: http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false When the "http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl" feature is set to "true" the parser will throw a FATAL ERROR if the incoming document contains a DOCTYPE declaration. When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external general entities. When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external parameter entities or the external DTD subset. If any of the validations fails, the operation will fail with an error message describing the problem. Default value\: http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false Results\: returnResult - This is the primary output. The edited XML. returnCode - 0 for success; -1 for failure. exception - The exception message in case one occured. Responses\: success - The operation completed as stated in the description. failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully. Notes\: 1. For the delete action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). Delete action modifies the XML only for type 'elem' or attr'. 2. For the insert action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, value, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). For type 'elem' insert adds the node before the resulting nodes of the XPath. For type 'text' insert adds the text before the text value of resulting nodes of the XPath. 3. For the append action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, value, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). For type 'elem' append adds the node after the resulting nodes of the XPath. For type 'text' append adds the text after the text value of resulting nodes of the XPath. 4. For insert and append attributes the order is the default alphabetical. 5. For the subnode action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1 and value. 6. For the move action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1 and xpath2. Move action modifies the XML only for type 'elem'. 7. For the rename action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, value, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). Rename action modifies the XML only for type 'elem' or attr'. 8. For the update action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, value, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). 9. The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) organization provides the XPath specification (http\://www.w3.org). 10. XML using default namespace is also supported by this operation. 11. An element from the default namespace can be retrieved using a location path. Examples\: 1. The following is a valid xpath example for working with a XML that uses default namespace. This example searches all "td" elements from the default namespace\: xml\:
Apples Bananas
xpath1\: //*[namespace-uri()\="http\://www.w3.org/TR/html4/" and name()\="td"] 1b56cd1d-aa5d-475c-b191-864e9f7ba574.8e37fbab-d47c-4d7d-8d7d-bb1fba5480d9.description=
Filters XML based on provided criteria. If 'path' is specified, searches XML for all paths that match the specified 'path'. Paths can be specified from the root element or as an arbitrary path. Elements can be further filtered based on one of the following criteria. You can filter based on the existence of a specified child element or that child having a specific value. Similarly you can also filter based on the existence of a specified attribute or that attribute having a specified value. You can however only filter based on either a child element or an attribute. For complex filtering, please use the XPath Evaluator operation. 

Inputs\:
    xml - The XML (in the form of a String).
    path - The path to the element. This field is optional. The operation returns all children if this field is empty.
    isPathFromRoot - Decides whether the "path" input field is specified from the root 
Default value\: false
Valid values\: true, false
    childName - Additionally, the operation should filter based on the existence of a child element named "childName". This field is optional. The operation does not filter based on "childName" if the field is empty.
    childValue - Additionally, the operation should filter based on the given "childName" having this value. This field is optional. The operation does not filter based on "childValue" if the field is empty.
    attributeName - Additionally, the operation should filter based on the existance of an attribute with the given "attributeName". This field is ptional. The operation does not filter based on "attributeName" if the field is empty.
    attributeValue - Additionally, the operation should filter based on the given "attributeName" having the value provided in this field. This field is optional. The operation does not filter based on "attributeValue" if the field is empty.
    parsingFeatures - The list of XML parsing features separated by new line (CRLF). The feature name - value must be separated by empty space. Setting specific features this field could be used to avoid XML security issues like "XML Entity Expansion injection" and "XML External Entity injection". To avoid aforementioned security issues we strongly recommend to set this input to the following values\: 
http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true 
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false 
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false 
When the "http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl" feature is set to "true" the parser will throw a FATAL ERROR if the incoming document contains a DOCTYPE declaration.  
When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external general entities. 
When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external parameter entities or the external DTD subset. 
If any of the validations fails, the operation will fail with an error message describing the problem. 
Default value\:
http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false

Returns\:
    returnResult - The filtered elements.

Responses\:
    has more - Another Element was found, and has been returned.
    failure - Something went wrong.
    no more - No more Elements. This will only be returned once , then iteration restarts.

Notes\:
1. The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) organization provides the XPath specification (http\://www.w3.org).
2. XML using default namespace is also supported by this operation.
3. An element from the default namespace can be retrieved using a location path.

Examples\:
1. The following is a valid inputs example for working with a XML that uses default namespace. This example searches all "td" elements from the default namespace\:
    xml\: 

                

                    Apples
                    Bananas
                 

            

    path\: //*[namespace-uri()\="http\://www.w3.org/TR/html4/" and name()\="td"]
1b56cd1d-aa5d-475c-b191-864e9f7ba574.a32d72e7-1ac4-4373-9e47-e6255d647d73.description=
Filters XML based on provided criteria. If 'path' is specified, searches XML for all paths that match the specified 'path'. Paths can be specified from the root element or as an arbitrary path. Elements can be further filtered based on one of the following criteria. You can filter based on the existence of a specified child element or that child having a specific value. Similarly you can also filter based on the existence of a specified attribute or that attribute having a specified value. You can however only filter based on either a child element or an attribute. For complex filtering, please use the XPath Evaluator operation. 

Inputs\:
    xml - The XML (in the form of a String).
    path - The path to the element. This field is optional. The operation returns all children if this field is empty.
    isPathFromRoot - Decides whether the "path" input field is specified from the root 
Default value\: false
Valid values\: true, false
    childName - Additionally, the operation should filter based on the existence of a child element named "childName". This field is optional. The operation does not filter based on "childName" if the field is empty.
    childValue - Additionally, the operation should filter based on the given "childName" having this value. This field is optional. The operation does not filter based on "childValue" if the field is empty.
    attributeName - Additionally, the operation should filter based on the existance of an attribute with the given "attributeName". This field is ptional. The operation does not filter based on "attributeName" if the field is empty.
    attributeValue - Additionally, the operation should filter based on the given "attributeName" having the value provided in this field. This field is optional. The operation does not filter based on "attributeValue" if the field is empty.
    parsingFeatures - The list of XML parsing features separated by new line (CRLF). The feature name - value must be separated by empty space. Setting specific features this field could be used to avoid XML security issues like "XML Entity Expansion injection" and "XML External Entity injection". To avoid aforementioned security issues we strongly recommend to set this input to the following values\: 
http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true 
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false 
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false 
When the "http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl" feature is set to "true" the parser will throw a FATAL ERROR if the incoming document contains a DOCTYPE declaration.  
When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external general entities. 
When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external parameter entities or the external DTD subset. 
If any of the validations fails, the operation will fail with an error message describing the problem. 
Default value\:
http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false

Returns\:
    returnResult - The filtered elements.

Responses\:
    has more - Another Element was found, and has been returned.
    failure - Something went wrong.
    no more - No more Elements. This will only be returned once , then iteration restarts.

Notes\:
1. The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) organization provides the XPath specification (http\://www.w3.org).
2. XML using default namespace is also supported by this operation.
3. An element from the default namespace can be retrieved using a location path.

Examples\:
1. The following is a valid inputs example for working with a XML that uses default namespace. This example searches all "td" elements from the default namespace\:
    xml\: 

                

                    Apples
                    Bananas
                 

            

    path\: //*[namespace-uri()\="http\://www.w3.org/TR/html4/" and name()\="td"]

The changes take place at the resulting elements. xpath2 - The XPath Query that is wanted to be run. For the move action the results of xpath1 are moved to the results of xpath2. value - The new value. Examples\: newNodeValue , newNodeValue, new value. type - Defines on what should the changes take effect \: the element, the value of the element or the attributes of the element. Valid values\: elem, text, attr name - The name of the attribute in case the selected type is 'attr' . parsingFeatures - The list of XML parsing features separated by new line (CRLF). The feature name - value must be separated by empty space. Setting specific features this field could be used to avoid XML security issues like "XML Entity Expansion injection" and "XML External Entity injection". To avoid aforementioned security issues we strongly recommend to set this input to the following values\: http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false When the "http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl" feature is set to "true" the parser will throw a FATAL ERROR if the incoming document contains a DOCTYPE declaration. When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external general entities. When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external parameter entities or the external DTD subset. If any of the validations fails, the operation will fail with an error message describing the problem. The edited XML. returnCode - 0 for success; -1 for failure. exception - The exception message in case one occured. Responses\: success - The operation completed as stated in the description. failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully. Notes\: 1. For the delete action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). Delete action modifies the XML only for type 'elem' or attr'. 2. For the insert action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, value, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). For type 'elem' insert adds the node before the resulting nodes of the XPath. For type 'text' insert adds the text before the text value of resulting nodes of the XPath. 3. For the append action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, value, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). For type 'elem' append adds the node after the resulting nodes of the XPath. For type 'text' append adds the text after the text value of resulting nodes of the XPath. 4. For insert and append attributes the order is the default alphabetical. 5. For the subnode action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1 and value. 6. For the move action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1 and xpath2. Move action modifies the XML only for type 'elem'. 7. For the rename action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, value, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). Rename action modifies the XML only for type 'elem' or attr'. 8. For the update action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, value, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). 9. The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) organization provides the XPath specification (http\://www.w3.org). 10. XML using default namespace is also supported by this operation. 11. An element from the default namespace can be retrieved using a location path. Examples\: 1. The following is a valid xpath example for working with a XML that uses default namespace. This example searches all "td" elements from the default namespace\: xml\:
Apples Bananas
xpath1\: //*[namespace-uri()\="http\://www.w3.org/TR/html4/" and name()\="td"] 1b56cd1d-aa5d-475c-b191-864e9f7ba574.be9890ae-1bc0-41e3-9464-2a7f0cb0fc7a.description=
Checks if a number or word is equal to another number or word. Word comparison is case-sensitive in alphabetical order.

Inputs\:
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.

Returns\:
value1 \=\= value2

Responses\:
success - The boolean operation was evaluated to true.
failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false.
1b56cd1d-aa5d-475c-b191-864e9f7ba574.cc48f9ef-60da-449c-bdd4-0f08b0834c27.description=Edits an XML document. Inputs\: xml - The XML (in the form of a String). filePath - Absolute or remote path of the XML file. action - The edit action to take place. Valid values\: delete, insert, append, subnode, move, rename, update. xpath1 - The XPath Query that is wanted to be run. The changes take place at the resulting elements. xpath2 - The XPath Query that is wanted to be run. For the move action the results of xpath1 are moved to the results of xpath2. value - The new value. Examples\: newNodeValue , newNodeValue, new value. type - Defines on what should the changes take effect \: the element, the value of the element or the attributes of the element. Valid values\: elem, text, attr name - The name of the attribute in case the selected type is 'attr' . parsingFeatures - The list of XML parsing features separated by new line (CRLF). The feature name - value must be separated by empty space. Setting specific features this field could be used to avoid XML security issues like "XML Entity Expansion injection" and "XML External Entity injection". To avoid aforementioned security issues we strongly recommend to set this input to the following values\: http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false When the "http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl" feature is set to "true" the parser will throw a FATAL ERROR if the incoming document contains a DOCTYPE declaration. When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external general entities. When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external parameter entities or the external DTD subset. If any of the validations fails, the operation will fail with an error message describing the problem. Default value\: http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false Results\: returnResult - This is the primary output. The edited XML. returnCode - 0 for success; -1 for failure. exception - The exception message in case one occured. Responses\: success - The operation completed as stated in the description. failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully. Notes\: 1. For the delete action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). Delete action modifies the XML only for type 'elem' or attr'. 2. For the insert action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, value, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). For type 'elem' insert adds the node before the resulting nodes of the XPath. For type 'text' insert adds the text before the text value of resulting nodes of the XPath. 3. For the append action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, value, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). For type 'elem' append adds the node after the resulting nodes of the XPath. For type 'text' append adds the text after the text value of resulting nodes of the XPath. 4. For insert and append attributes the order is the default alphabetical. 5. For the subnode action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1 and value. 6. For the move action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1 and xpath2. Move action modifies the XML only for type 'elem'. 7. For the rename action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, value, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). Rename action modifies the XML only for type 'elem' or attr'. 8. For the update action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, value, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). 9. The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) organization provides the XPath specification (http\://www.w3.org). 10. XML using default namespace is also supported by this operation. 11. An element from the default namespace can be retrieved using a location path. Examples\: 1. The following is a valid xpath example for working with a XML that uses default namespace. This example searches all "td" elements from the default namespace\: xml\:
Apples Bananas
xpath1\: //*[namespace-uri()\="http\://www.w3.org/TR/html4/" and name()\="td"] 1b56cd1d-aa5d-475c-b191-864e9f7ba574.d891ccf9-aaf3-4c7f-a3c7-b3a48ae817fb.description=Edits an XML document. Inputs\: xml - The XML (in the form of a String). filePath - Absolute or remote path of the XML file. action - The edit action to take place. Valid values\: delete, insert, append, subnode, move, rename, update. xpath1 - The XPath Query that is wanted to be run. The changes take place at the resulting elements. xpath2 - The XPath Query that is wanted to be run. For the move action the results of xpath1 are moved to the results of xpath2. value - The new value. When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external parameter entities or the external DTD subset. If any of the validations fails, the operation will fail with an error message describing the problem. Default value\: http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false Results\: returnResult - This is the primary output. The edited XML. returnCode - 0 for success; -1 for failure. exception - The exception message in case one occured. Delete action modifies the XML only for type 'elem' or attr'. 2. For type 'elem' insert adds the node before the resulting nodes of the XPath. For type 'text' insert adds the text before the text value of resulting nodes of the XPath. 3. For the append action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, value, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). For type 'elem' append adds the node after the resulting nodes of the XPath. For type 'text' append adds the text after the text value of resulting nodes of the XPath. 4. For insert and append attributes the order is the default alphabetical. 5. For the subnode action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1 and value. 6. Rename action modifies the XML only for type 'elem' or attr'. 8. For the update action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, value, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). 9. When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external general entities. When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external parameter entities or the external DTD subset. If any of the validations fails, the operation will fail with an error message describing the problem. Default value\: http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false Results\: returnResult - This is the primary output. The edited XML. returnCode - 0 for success; -1 for failure. exception - The exception message in case one occured. Responses\: success - The operation completed as stated in the description. failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully. Notes\: 1. For the delete action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). Delete action modifies the XML only for type 'elem' or attr'. 2. For the insert action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, value, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). For type 'elem' insert adds the node before the resulting nodes of the XPath. For type 'text' insert adds the text before the text value of resulting nodes of the XPath. 3. For type 'elem' append adds the node after the resulting nodes of the XPath. For type 'text' append adds the text after the text value of resulting nodes of the XPath. 4. For insert and append attributes the order is the default alphabetical. 5. For the subnode action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1 and value. 6. For the move action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1 and xpath2. Move action modifies the XML only for type 'elem'. 7. For the rename action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, value, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). Rename action modifies the XML only for type 'elem' or attr'. 8. For the update action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, value, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). 9. The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) organization provides the XPath specification (http\://www.w3.org). 10. XML using default namespace is also supported by this operation. 11. This example searches all "td" elements from the default namespace\: xml\:

Valid values\: delete, insert, append, subnode, move, rename, update. xpath1 - The XPath Query that is wanted to be run. The changes take place at the resulting elements. xpath2 - The XPath Query that is wanted to be run. For the move action the results of xpath1 are moved to the results of xpath2. value - The new value. Examples\: newNodeValue , newNodeValue, new value. type - Defines on what should the changes take effect \: the element, the value of the element or the attributes of the element. Valid values\: elem, text, attr name - The name of the attribute in case the selected type is 'attr' . parsingFeatures - The list of XML parsing features separated by new line (CRLF). The feature name - value must be separated by empty space. Setting specific features this field could be used to avoid XML security issues like "XML Entity Expansion injection" and "XML External Entity injection". To avoid aforementioned security issues we strongly recommend to set this input to the following values\: http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false When the "http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl" feature is set to "true" the parser will throw a FATAL ERROR if the incoming document contains a DOCTYPE declaration. When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external general entities. When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external parameter entities or the external DTD subset. If any of the validations fails, the operation will fail with an error message describing the problem. Default value\: http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false Results\: returnResult - This is the primary output. The edited XML. returnCode - 0 for success; -1 for failure. exception - The exception message in case one occured. Responses\: success - The operation completed as stated in the description. failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully. Notes\: 1. For the delete action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). Delete action modifies the XML only for type 'elem' or attr'. 2. For the insert action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, value, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). For type 'elem' insert adds the node before the resulting nodes of the XPath. For type 'text' insert adds the text before the text value of resulting nodes of the XPath. 3. For the append action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, value, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). For type 'elem' append adds the node after the resulting nodes of the XPath. For type 'text' append adds the text after the text value of resulting nodes of the XPath. 4. For insert and append attributes the order is the default alphabetical. 5. For the subnode action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1 and value. 6. For the move action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1 and xpath2. Move action modifies the XML only for type 'elem'. 7. For the rename action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, value, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). Rename action modifies the XML only for type 'elem' or attr'. 8. For the update action the following inputs are required\: xml or filePath, xpath1, value, type and in case type is 'attr' then name is also required (representing the attributes name). 9. The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) organization provides the XPath specification (http\://www.w3.org). 10. XML using default namespace is also supported by this operation. 11. An element from the default namespace can be retrieved using a location path. Examples\: 1. The following is a valid xpath example for working with a XML that uses default namespace. This example searches all "td" elements from the default namespace\: xml\:
Apples Bananas
xpath1\: //*[namespace-uri()\="http\://www.w3.org/TR/html4/" and name()\="td"] 1b56cd1d-aa5d-475c-b191-864e9f7ba574.f64bb21f-1011-4469-9280-29fd1be18d04.description=
Filters XML based on provided criteria. If 'path' is specified, searches XML for all paths that match the specified 'path'. Paths can be specified from the root element or as an arbitrary path. Elements can be further filtered based on one of the following criteria. You can filter based on the existence of a specified child element or that child having a specific value. Similarly you can also filter based on the existence of a specified attribute or that attribute having a specified value. You can however only filter based on either a child element or an attribute. For complex filtering, please use the XPath Evaluator operation. 

Inputs\:
    xml - The XML (in the form of a String).
    path - The path to the element. This field is optional. The operation returns all children if this field is empty.
    isPathFromRoot - Decides whether the "path" input field is specified from the root 
Default value\: false
Valid values\: true, false
    childName - Additionally, the operation should filter based on the existence of a child element named "childName". This field is optional. The operation does not filter based on "childName" if the field is empty.
    childValue - Additionally, the operation should filter based on the given "childName" having this value. This field is optional. The operation does not filter based on "childValue" if the field is empty.
    attributeName - Additionally, the operation should filter based on the existance of an attribute with the given "attributeName". This field is ptional. The operation does not filter based on "attributeName" if the field is empty.
    attributeValue - Additionally, the operation should filter based on the given "attributeName" having the value provided in this field. This field is optional. The operation does not filter based on "attributeValue" if the field is empty.
    parsingFeatures - The list of XML parsing features separated by new line (CRLF). The feature name - value must be separated by empty space. Setting specific features this field could be used to avoid XML security issues like "XML Entity Expansion injection" and "XML External Entity injection". To avoid aforementioned security issues we strongly recommend to set this input to the following values\: 
http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true 
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false 
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false 
When the "http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl" feature is set to "true" the parser will throw a FATAL ERROR if the incoming document contains a DOCTYPE declaration.  
When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external general entities. 
When the "http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities" feature is set to "false" the parser will not include external parameter entities or the external DTD subset. 
If any of the validations fails, the operation will fail with an error message describing the problem. 
Default value\:
http\://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl true
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities false
http\://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities false

Returns\:
    returnResult - The filtered elements.

Responses\:
    has more - Another Element was found, and has been returned.
    failure - Something went wrong.
    no more - No more Elements. This will only be returned once , then iteration restarts.

Notes\:
1. The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) organization provides the XPath specification (http\://www.w3.org).
2. XML using default namespace is also supported by this operation.
3. An element from the default namespace can be retrieved using a location path.

Examples\:
1. The following is a valid inputs example for working with a XML that uses default namespace. This example searches all "td" elements from the default namespace\:
    xml\: 

                

                    Apples
                    Bananas
                 

            

    path\: //*[namespace-uri()\="http\://www.w3.org/TR/html4/" and name()\="td"]
flow.name: Edit VM XML
